title: Jamal Ford-Robinson
text:
Jamal Ford-Robinson (born 11 September 1993) is a <a href="Rugby%20Union">rugby union</a> player who plays for <a href="English%20Premiership%20%28rugby%20union%29">Premiership Rugby</a> side <a href="Gloucester%20Rugby">Gloucester</a>. Jamal can also be found live streaming on the popular gaming platform <a href="Twitch%20%28service%29">Twitch</a> under the username <a href="https%3A//www.twitch.tv/makinui_">Makinui_</a>.
Jamal has also spent time wrestling under the ring name 'Krisys' before returning to play for Bristol Rugby.
Club career.
Beginning his rugby career in <a href="Leicester%20Tigers">Leicester Tigers</a>'s Academy structure, Ford-Robinson then moved to <a href="National%20League%201">National League 1</a> club <a href="Cambridge%20R.U.F.C.">Cambridge</a> for two seasons before progressing to <a href="RFU%20Championship">RFU Championship</a> side <a href="Cornish%20Pirates">Cornish Pirates</a> in 2014.
Ford-Robinson then switched to <a href="Bristol%20Rugby">Bristol Rugby</a> for the 2015/16 season and aided in their promotion into the <a href="English%20Premiership%20%28rugby%20union%29">Aviva Premiership</a> that season. The prop made 48 appearances in a Bristol shirt and suffered with the club as they were relegated back to the Championship at the end of the 2016/17 campaign. The young prop left his hometown of Bristol to join <a href="Northampton%20Saints">Northampton Saints</a> for the 2017/18 season after signing for the Midlands club on February 2, 2017. In March 2019, Ford-Robinson signed a 2-year deal with Premiership Rivals <a href="Gloucester%20Rugby">Gloucester Rugby</a>. Following the <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic">COVID-19 pandemic</a> in early 2020, Jamal started making humorous videos on the video-sharing website <a href="TikTok">TikTok</a>. The videos gained wide attention from the rugby community which lead to Ford-Robinson winning <a href="Premiership%20Rugby">Premiership Rugby</a>'s Community Player of the Month.
International career.
Before joining Northampton, Ford-Robinson was noticed by <a href="England%20Rugby">England</a> and was first called into the international team that defeated the <a href="Barbarians%20F.C.">Barbarians</a> in a non-cap friendly at Twickenham on 28 May 2017, before being added to the touring squad that travelled to <a href="Argentina">Argentina</a> in the summer of 2017 as injury cover for <a href="Worcester%20Warriors">Worcester Warriors</a>' Nick Schonert.
